Hi Erik,

With Heritrix-3.0 comes the capability to increase the number o=
f parallel queues from default 1 to as_many_as_you_wish. 
So I think you wi=
ll have to switch to H3.0 to make use of the feature.

Thanks,
Pranay


---=
 On Fri, 1/8/10, Crawler User <crawleruser@...> wrote:

From: Crawl=
er User <crawleruser@...>
Subject: [archive-crawler] heritrix-1.14.=
2: crawling faster than 5 docs/sec ; crawling more than 1 URI at a time fro=
m a single host
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, January 8=
, 2010, 3:41 PM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      


hi. =C2=
=A0I need to increase my crawl rate on some hosts that I have permission to=
 crawl quickly. =C2=A0
The fastest I can get the crawl to go right now is 5=
 docs/second, with maximum "impoliteness" (delayFactor=3D 0.0, maxDelayMs=
=3D0, minDelayMs=3D0). =C2=A0This is not quick enough for my needs.
I'm ass=
uming the bottleneck is this limitation:=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0"It is impo=
rtant to note that at any given time only one URI from any given host is pr=
ocessed."=C2=A0=C2=A0 =C2=A0 =C2=A0-- from:=C2=A0https://webarchive. jira.c=
om/ wiki/display/ Heritrix/ Frontier+ Settings
I'm hoping that others have =
thought of a way to workaround or ideally remove the "1-URI-at-a- time" res=
triction from Heritrix.
BTW, I dug through the archives and found this thre=
ad:=C2=A0=C2=A0http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ archive-crawler/ messa=
ge/2933
However, the suggested solution of writing my own=C2=A0QueueAssignm=
entPoli cy, and handling prerequisite problems,=C2=A0seems a little involve=
d for me.So I'm wondering if in the last 3.5 years this has become easier t=
o accomplish.I'm hopeful that this statement from Gordon Mohr on that threa=
d was prescient and the "multiple simultaneous URIs" option has returned:
=
=C2=A0=C2=A0 (An earlier=C2=A0frontier implementation had an option for pro=
cessing multiple URLs=C2=A0from a single queue/host at once, but the option=
 was not carried
=C2=A0=C2=A0 =C2=A0forward to the current recommended fron=
tier implementation.=C2=A0=C2=A0It may=C2=A0return as an option in a future=
 version.)
I eagerly await your replies, Thanks!
-Erik
